      Makes all files in a provided directory available via the web server
      void all(String path, Request handler)
      Create a listener for ALL requests at the given path (Also accepts Regex) Requests are handled in the order they are added You can use return to skip a request handler and move on to the next.

      Starts the Express4J server on the provided port
      void listen(int port, String hostname)
      Starts the Express4J server on the provided hostname and port
      void listen(int port, String hostname, int backlog)
      Starts the Express4J server on the provided hostname and port with a backlog limit Backlogs are the maximum number of requests the server will queue at one time If this limit is reached, the server will refuse the request

      • get

        public void get(String path,
                Request handler)
        Create a listener for GET requests at the given path (Also accepts Regex) Requests are handled in the order they are added You can use return to skip a request handler and move on to the next.

        Example: "/.*" will accept ALL requests
        Parameters:
        path -
        handler -

      • listen

        public void listen(int port,
                   String hostname,
                   int backlog)
            throws IOException
        Starts the Express4J server on the provided hostname and port with a backlog limit Backlogs are the maximum number of requests the server will queue at one time If this limit is reached, the server will refuse the request
        Parameters:
        port -
        hostname -
        backlog -
        Throws:
        IOException
